main_definition: Anna is a given name of Hebrew origin, but it can also be an idiom or phrase in English with various meanings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A diminutive form of the name Anna used as a term of endearment
meanings_and_examples.example: She loves to call her little sister 'Anna-belle'.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In some English dialects, it is slang for money or wealth
meanings_and_examples.example: He didn't have any anna to spare on a new pair of shoes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in certain contexts to refer to the concept of 'golden girl' or someone who is considered perfect and highly desirable
meanings_and_examples.example: She was seen as the anna at her high school, everyone admired her for being talented and kind.
